title: on me by sections 3 and 15(5) of the International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the International Protection Act
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the International Protection Act 

2015 (Application for International Protection Form) Regulations 2024. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on 24 July 2024.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited international protection act 2015 (application international protection form) regulation 2024 (2) regulation shall come operation 24 july 2024

title: on me by sections 3 and 15(5) of the International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66
heading: 2. The form set out in the Schedule is prescribed for the purposes of section
text_raw:
2. The form set out in the Schedule is prescribed for the purposes of section 

15(5) of the International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66 of 2015).
text_norm: 2 form set schedule prescribed purpose section 15(5) international protection act 2015 (no 66 2015)

title: on me by sections 3 and 15(5) of the International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66
heading: 3. The International Protection Act 2015 (Application for International
text_raw:
3. The International Protection Act 2015 (Application for International 

Protection Form) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 660 of 2016) are revoked. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 26th July, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [366] 3
text_norm: 3 international protection act 2015 (application international protection form) regulation 2016 (s.i no 660 2016) revoked notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 26th july 2024 366 3

heading: Particulars and declarations which shall be provided on application for

Particulars and declarations which shall be provided on application for 
International Protection.

heading: 1. Consent
text_raw:

i. 

Capture of declaration that applicant has read International 
Protection Office Data Protection Notice 

ii. Capture of signature 

iii. Date of signature

title: on me by sections 3 and 15(5) of the International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66
heading: 4. Details of the grounds for the application, including:
text_raw:
4. Details of the grounds for the application, including: 

i. 

Intention to apply for International Protection 

ii. Grounds 

for 
race/religion/nationality/membership 
group/political/none of these 

seeking 

refugee 

of 

particular 

status: 
social 

iii. Detailed reason(s) for claiming International Protection 

 
 
 8 [366] 

iv. Details of specific event(s) in the Country of Origin or Country 
of Former Habitual Residence which have resulted in the 
applicant fearing to return home, and the reason(s) why the 
applicant decided to leave their Country of Origin or Country of 
Former Habitual Residence 

v. Details of specific person, organisation, or group in Country of 
Origin or Country of Former Habitual Residence that the 
applicant would fear were they to return home 

vi. Details of any political activities in which the applicant engaged 
in their Country of Origin or Country of Former Habitual 
Residence

title: on me by sections 3 and 15(5) of the International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66
heading: 5. Reasons for which dependent(s) fear persecution
text_raw:
5. Reasons for which dependent(s) fear persecution 

i. 

ii. 

iii. 

Indication as to whether dependent(s) share the same reason(s) 
for applying for International Protection, if applicable 

Name(s) of dependent(s) in the State as part of the application 

Details as to why dependent(s) have well-founded fear of 
persecution, if different from grounds provided by applicant
text_norm: 5 reason dependent(s) fear persecution i ii iii indication whether dependent(s) share reason(s) applying international protection applicable name(s) dependent(s) state part application detail dependent(s) well-founded fear persecution different ground provided applicant

title: on me by sections 3 and 15(5) of the International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66
heading: 6. Subsidiary protection: serious harm
text_raw:
6. Subsidiary protection: serious harm 

i. 

Details, if any, of reason(s) for which the applicant is at risk of 
‘serious harm’: 

death penalty or execution / torture or inhuman or 
degrading treatment or punishment of a person in his or her 
Country of Origin / serious and individual threat to a 
civilian’s life or person by reason of indiscriminate violence 
in a situation of international or internal armed conflict 

ii. 

Details of what the applicant fears may happen if they return to 
Country of Origin or Country of Former Habitual Residence
text_norm: 6 subsidiary protection serious harm i detail reason(s) applicant risk serious harm death penalty execution torture inhuman degrading treatment punishment person country origin serious individual threat civilian life person reason indiscriminate violence situation international internal armed conflict ii detail applicant fear may happen return country origin country former habitual residence

heading: 7. Reason(s) for which dependent(s) fear serious harm
text_raw:
7. Reason(s) for which dependent(s) fear serious harm 

i. 

Indication as to whether dependent(s) share the same reason(s) 
for fearing serious harm 

ii. Name(s) of dependent(s) in the State as part of the application 

iii. Details as to why dependent(s) fear serious harm, if different from 

grounds provided by applicant 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [366] 9
text_norm: 7 reason(s) dependent(s) fear serious harm i indication whether dependent(s) share reason(s) fearing serious harm ii name(s) dependent(s) state part application iii detail dependent(s) fear serious harm different ground provided applicant 366 9

title: on me by sections 3 and 15(5) of the International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66
heading: 8. Safe Country of Origin (only to be completed by applicants whose
text_raw:
8. Safe Country of Origin (only to be completed by applicants whose 

Country of Origin is subject to a designation under section 72 of the Act) 

i. 

Reason(s) as to why the applicant considers their Country of 
Origin to be unsafe in their case and for their dependent(s), if 
applicable

title: on me by sections 3 and 15(5) of the International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66
heading: 9. Reporting of incident(s)
text_raw:
9. Reporting of incident(s) 

i. 

ii. 

iii. 

iv. 

Indication as to whether the applicant reported incident(s) which 
occurred to them and/or dependent(s) to the authorities in Country 
of Origin or Country of Former Habitual Residence: yes / no 

If no, details as to why the applicant did not report the incident(s) 

If yes, details of when and to whom the report(s) was/were made 

Details of action(s) taken by authorities, if applicable
text_norm: 9 reporting incident(s) i ii iii iv indication whether applicant reported incident(s) occurred dependent(s) authority country origin country former habitual residence yes detail applicant report incident(s) yes detail report(s) made detail action(s) taken authority applicable

title: on me by sections 3 and 15(5) of the International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66
heading: 10. Permission to remain
text_raw:
10. Permission to remain 

i. 

Details of all information that would, in the event that sections 
49, 50, 56, or 57 of the Act were to apply to the applicant, be 
relevant to the decision of the Minister under the section 
concerned, including: 

a) 

b) 

c) 

d) 

e) 

f) 

the type of connection the applicant has with Ireland, if any; 

humanitarian considerations (such as health matters); 

character and conduct (behaviour) in Ireland, including 
criminal convictions; 

character and conduct outside Ireland, including criminal 
convictions; 

national security and public order concerns; 

anything else that may affect the common good (the 
benefits and interests) of all the people in the State
text_norm: 10 permission remain i detail information would event section 49 50 56 57 act apply applicant relevant decision minister section concerned including a) b) c) d) e) f) type connection applicant ireland humanitarian consideration (such health matters) character conduct (behaviour) ireland including criminal conviction character conduct outside ireland including criminal conviction national security public order concern anything else may affect common good (the benefit interests) people state

title: on me by sections 3 and 15(5) of the International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66
heading: 10.1 Family member(s)
text_raw:
10.1 Family member(s) 

i. 

ii. 

Indication as to whether the applicant has any family member(s) 
in the State not previously mentioned in the application: yes / no 

If yes, details of that family member’s: first and last name(s), 
gender (male / female / unspecified / other), nationality, 
immigration status in Ireland, date of birth, relationship to the 
applicant
text_norm: 10.1 family member(s) i ii indication whether applicant family member(s) state previously mentioned application yes yes detail family member first last name(s) gender (male female unspecified other) nationality immigration status ireland date birth relationship applicant

title: on me by sections 3 and 15(5) of the International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66
heading: 10.2 Conviction of crime
text_raw:
10.2 Conviction of crime 

i. 

Indication as to whether applicant is the subject of an ongoing 
criminal investigation or has committed, been charged with, or 

 
 
 
 
 
 10 [366] 

convicted of, any criminal offence in the State or in any other 
country: yes / no 

ii. 

If yes, details of: conviction/charge/offence for which applicant 
is under investigation, including: country of conviction; offence 
with which applicant was charged; date of charge; details of 
prison sentence served, if any, including dates and type of 
sentence 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

23 July, 2024. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [366] 11

title: on me by sections 3 and 15(5) of the International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations repeal S.I. 660 of 2016. 

The purpose of the new Regulation is to update the format of the application 
form under the International Protection Act in order to facilitate digitalisation of 
the application process. 

 
 
 
 
 12 [366]
